DOCNAME: T. DALSGAARD AND J. DALSGAARD  v. DENMARK
TEXT: The first applicant , PERSON , and the second applicant , PERSON , are spouses . They are NORP nationals , born in DATE and DATE respectively and live in GPE . They are represented before ORG , a lawyer practising in GPE . The Government are represented by their Agent , PERSON of ORG .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .
The applicants ran a freshwater fish farm , which formally was owned by the first applicant .

On respectively CARDINAL and DATE the applicants were interviewed by the police and charged with offences against the LAW on freshwater fish farms of DATE ( bekendtgørelse nr . CARDINAL ) , as allegedly during DATE , they had for their own enrichment intentionally exceeded the fixed feed quotas with danger or risk thereof to the environment . An indictment was issued on DATE and filed with ORG of PERSON ( retten i PERSON ) on DATE . As the applicants continued to exceed the fixed feed quotas , the indictment was succeeded by supplementary indictments of CARDINAL DATE , CARDINAL DATE , DATE , CARDINAL DATE and DATE concerning DATE ; the CARDINAL latter concerning an amended Act on freshwater fish farms ( bekendtgørelse nr . CARDINAL ) of DATE , and the latter including charges as to breach of LAW ( PERSON ) .

On DATE the case was adjourned awaiting the outcome of a corresponding pending criminal case , considered to be a “ test - case ” , in which the defendant had alleged inter alia that the CARDINAL Act had no legal authority as it contravened articles of LAW and provisions of LAW ( PERSON ) . The applicants did not object to this adjournment . The proceedings in the test - case were finally determined on appeal by a ORG judgment of CARDINAL DATE which stated that the LAW provided the requisite authority and that the sanction for any violation of it should be imposition of a fine and confiscation of any profit . As a consequence of the judgment ORG of Aalborg ( Statsadvokaten i Aalborg ) , who at the relevant time had CARDINAL similar cases being prosecuted by him in the first instance , forwarded a memorandum to all the Chief Constables in DATE , urging them to expedite the “ fish farms cases ” .

However , in DATE a defendant in another test - case alleged that the CARDINAL Act was anti - competitive and therefore in conflict with ORG law , resulting in ORG of Aalborg requesting ORG ) and GPE set up by ORG ( PERSON for juridiske spørgsmål ) to provide an opinion . Neither found that the LAW fell within the scope of LAW of the ORG treaty , and in DATE , as to the specific test - case , ORG ruled that it found no reason to refer to question to ORG . Against this background in the DATE ORG of GPE forwarded CARDINAL memorandums to the Chief Constables urging them to expedite the fish farm cases as much as possible .

In the meantime , in DATE in yet another test - case , a defendant had alleged in vain that the CARDINAL Act was contrary to section CARDINAL of LAW . Consequently , in DATE ORG of Sønderborg ( Statsadvokaten i ORG ) forwarded a memorandum to all the Chief Constables providing an account of the latest development in the cases concerning fish farms and urging to expedite them .

Also , in the meantime investigation and administrative appeals had been ongoing resulting in the supplementary indictments of CARDINAL DATE , CARDINAL DATE and DATE being filed with ORG of PERSON , and the trial had been scheduled to take place on DATE .

On DATE the applicants retained a new counsel , who shortly thereafter requested an adjournment of the case in order to go through the material and to obtain an expert opinion on the confiscation amount . His request was granted . Therefore , and due to counsel ’s engagement elsewhere , the trial was scheduled to take place on CARDINAL and DATE .
CARDINAL supplementary indictments of CARDINAL DATE and DATE were filed with ORG of Terndrup .

By judgment of CARDINAL DATE the applicants were convicted . The first applicant was sentenced to pay a fine of CARDINAL Danish kroner ( ORG ) and her profit estimated to DKK CARDINAL was confiscated . The second applicant was fined of DKK CARDINAL . In addition , DATE fines in the amount of DKK CARDINAL were to be imposed on the applicants up until DATE or until they had complied with a prohibition of DATE that had been issued by the regional environmental protection authorities ( PERSON ) against carrying on business on a specific part of the applicants’ freshwater fish farm .

On appeal to ORG GPE ( PERSON ) counsel requested information from the prosecution as to whether LAW had been notified to ORG , since in the affirmative he would request a preliminary reference to ORG .

At the relevant time CARDINAL test - cases were already pending before ORG ( Højesteret ) in which the CARDINAL defendants ( see PERSON and PERSON v. GPE , no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL , DATE ) had maintained that the relevant Act lacked legal authority because ORG had not been notified of it as prescribed by a ORG , for which reason they requested the case referred to ORG for a preliminary ruling .
Consequently , in DATE the Prosecutor General ( PERSON ) found that all cases concerning LAW should await the outcome of the cases pending before ORG .
The decision to adjourn the present case in accordance therewith was taken formally by ORG on DATE .

In the test - cases , on DATE ORG decided not to refer the cases to ORG for a preliminary ruling and on DATE ORG passed judgments , published in the Danish Weekly Law Reports ( ORG for DATE , pp . CARDINAL and CARDINAL ( see PERSON and PERSON v. GPE cited above ) .
On DATE the Prosecutor General forwarded a letter to ORG and others stating that the adjourned cases could now proceed .

On DATE ORG requested ORG to set down the applicant ’s cases for trial , however , since the Prosecution and the environmental authorities had to discuss and coordinate the claims made in all the cases concerning fish farming , ORG requested that the case was not scheduled before DATE .
On DATE ORG scheduled the trial for DATE .
On DATE the Prosecutor General procured guidelines to the prosecution ( ORG nr . CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) on how to go about with this kind of criminal cases and which sentences to propose .
On DATE counsel informed ORG that the applicants wished to change counsel , namely to the lawyer who had represented the defendants ( ORG before ORG .
On DATE the ORG new counsel forwarded a request to ORG of Aalborg for the production of CARDINAL additional witnesses and a proposal that the trial be postponed .

In a letter of DATE to the ORG counsel made various submissions in favour of adjourning the case , inter alia that he maintained his request for additional evidence and that the case ought to await the decision of ORG in the case PERSON and PERSON v. GPE ( cited above ) .

In spite of objections by ORG , on DATE ORG decided to adjourn the case . Instead a preparatory hearing was held on DATE , during which counsel ’s request for the production of additional evidence was refused . The trial was listed to take place on CARDINAL and DATE .
The applicants’ request for leave to appeal against ORG decision of DATE to ORG was refused by the Leave to Appeal Board ( Procesbevillingsnævnet ) on DATE .

By judgment of DATE ORG GPE upheld the applicants’ convictions , but partly amended the sentences to be imposed . Thus , the first applicant was sentenced to pay a fine of CARDINAL Danish kroner ( ORG ) and her profit estimated to DKK CARDINAL was confiscated ; the second applicant was fined of DKK CARDINAL ; and ORG imposition of DATE fines was quashed .
The ORG complaint that the length of the proceedings had exceeded a reasonable time was rejected by ORG stating inter alia :

“ Since the issuing of the indictment in DATE , the progress of the case has been influenced inter alia by the fact that the case during longer periods had to await the outcome of other similar cases , including cases which were finally determined by ORG ( Højesteret ) . [ Having regard thereto ] , the length of the proceedings did not breach LAW as to a trial within a reasonable time . ”

On DATE the applicants requested leave to appeal against the High ORG judgment to ORG . In support thereof they maintained , inter alia , that the length of the proceedings was in violation of LAW . Their request was refused by the Leave to Appeal Board on DATE .
ORG provides in as far as relevant :
Section CARDINAL , subsection CARDINAL

ORG notifies ORG of the scheduling of the trial , and informs [ him or her ] and the accused about assignment of counsel [ if any ] . The information to the accused thereon may be given through ORG in connection with the serving of the summons .
